Rules and Recommendations

It is now allowed to photograph in ateliers if there is not more than 1 customer on 15m², distancing of 2 meters from each other is observed. Facemasks or respirators are mandatory except for the exact time of the photoshoot.

Photographing can now take place indoors in a group with a maximum of 10 persons in the group including the photograph.

Photographers can take pictures at weddings (they count within the 30 people limit). For services and religious gatherings is the limit 30% of people from total seating capacity.

Bear in mind that COVID-19 did not disappear with the lift of bans on free movement and on shops and services. Be considerate to colleagues and customers, follow strictly hygienic rules, try to avoid close distance photography – keep at least 2 meters distance from other people, and wear face masks all the time.

update.processed:
• Providing photographic services in establishments is prohibited.

  • In order to perform the profession, photographers will be free to move around in the outdoor areas and take pictures of the city or nature. However, it is not possible to organise a client photoshoot outdoors as this would be a violation of the measures imposed on the free movement of persons.

  • Photographers can take pictures at weddings (they count within the 20 people limit).
  • It is allowed to visit customers in their homes, however, it is not recommended because of the obvious danger of disease transmission. Use this option only in case of necessity. Wear a face mask all the time and strictly follow hygienic rules and measures. Do not stay in the place for longer than needed.

Specific rules and measures will be officially released on the press conference of the government.
